Welcome to Flask Examples’s documentation!¶

Numbers API¶

The numbers API allows you to track why you like different numbers.

It’s like asking why is Ludwig van Beethoven’s Ninth Symphony beautiful. If you don’t see why, someone can’t tell you. I know numbers are beautiful. If they aren’t beautiful, nothing is. – Paul Erdos

The Numbers API is for when you really must track your favorite numbers.

Warning

This implementation does not persist data across sessions. Also, if it is run with multiple server processes, their data will not synchronize.

class flask_app.Numbers(api=None, *args, **kwargs)¶
get()¶

Get the full list of favorite numbers

Route

/my-api GET

Returns

A list of favorite numbers, each with:

  • id a unqiue int identifier

  • number the favorite number

  • description the reason it is a favorite

post()¶

Post a new favorite number; server assigns the id

Appends a favorite number with a description into the collection, assigning it a new unique identifier in the collection. Returns the new identifier.

Route

/my-api POST

Payload
Submit a JSON object with:

  • number: the new favorite number (int)

  • description: reason it’s a favorite (str)

Error

400 if missing either number or description field

Returns

Newly assigned identifier

class flask_app.OneNumber(api=None, *args, **kwargs)¶
get(id)¶

Get a single favorite number selected by its id

Gets both the number and the description of why its a favorite number if the id is valid, otherwise produces an error code.

Route

/my-api/<int:id> GET

Parameters

id (int) – favorite number identifier

Error

404 if id is not in the collection

Returns

A single favorite number with:

  • id a unqiue int identifier

  • number the favorite number

  • description the reason it is a favorite
